page.title: 14ESKDALEMUIR RURAL INSTITUTE
page.content: Eskdalemuir Womens Rural Institute still meets every month from September to April,though numbers have sadly declined due to afforestation and the establishment of a Buddhist non-participating community. Thus it is now a struggle to keep the "rural" going, as it is difficult and indeed embarassing to ask speakers or demonstrators to come so far , perhaps in inclement weather to talk to so few members. We try to swell our numbers by inviting ladies from neighbouring parishes to join us.We have many happy nights enjoying the company and exchange of ideas.Subjects range from cookery,crochet,flower arranging, basket work,weavings.Sometimes a keep-fit night a travel talk with slides .Visits are arranged to the Pantomime and Operatic Society productions in nearby towns.
